title: Consumer Price Index Seen Up 1.8% Y/Y — Data Week Ahead Update
text:
The following are forecasts for this week's remaining U.S. data from a survey compiled by The Wall Street Journal.

DATE TIME RELEASE PERIOD CONSENSUS PREVIOUS (ET) Monday 1500 Consumer Credit Aug +$15.0B (9) +$23.29B Tuesday 0600 Small Business Svy Sep 102.0 (7) 103.1 0830 Producer Price Index Sep +0.1% (21) +0.1% -- ex food & energy Sep +0.2% (17) +0.3% -- ex food, energy, trade Sep +0.2% (6) +0.4% Wednesday 1000 Job Openings Aug 7.2M (5) 7.22M & Labor Turnover 1000 Wholesale Inventories Aug +0.4% (10) +0.2% Thursday 0830 Jobless Claims Oct 5 218K (17) 219K 0830 Consumer Price Index M/M Sep +0.1% (23) +0.1% -- ex food & energy M/M Sep +0.2% (22) +0.3% 0830 Consumer Price Index Y/Y Sep +1.8% (15) +1.7% -- ex food & energy Y/Y Sep +2.4% (15) +2.4% Friday 0830 Import Prices Sep +0.0% (11) -0.5% 1000 Consumer Sentiment Oct 92.0 (17) 93.2* (Prelim) *End-September Reading (Figures in parentheses refer to number of economists surveyed.)

Write to Donna Huneke at dataweekahead@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 07, 2019 13:59 ET (17:59 GMT)
